messages.message:
Hi Team,

I’ve merged a PR to use `gunicorn` instead of `gevent` to serve our front-facing flask based webservices. Moving away from `gevent` will help us to tackle some of the issues we regularly see like services getting unresponsive during CPU intensive ops, gRPC issues with file-service-v2, no graceful termination of the Pods, etc. I hope this change will be a good step towards improving the stability and reliability of the entire platform.

Also, since this PR will fundamentally change how our HTTP requests are processed so I’d be expecting some unexpected behaviours and if you find any then please let us know in the <#C01P0CCKXKJ|> Slack channel.

Thanks,

cc: @shaunak
awesome, Shubham! Looking forward to an Instabase world without gevent.
